text:
apachectl configtest should balk if ScriptAlias is used and mod_cgi is not loaded.
It's a meaningless directive sans CGI, and the lack of warnings masks its absence;
yes it falls back to being a normal Alias, but that doesn't help one figure out
why scripts aren't executing when there are no errors logged.
creator: belg4mit@pthbb.org
poirier@pobox.com
text:
It would be nice, but it's not really possible to do that.

ScriptAlias doesn't exactly make mod_cgi handle the request, it just sets the request's handler to be "cgi-script".  There's no way for ScriptAlias to know if there's a module loaded that is willing to handle those requests.
